pullRequest.body:
We split `Mathlib/AlgebraicTopology/SimplexCategory.lean` into two files, `SimplexCategory/Defs.lean` and `SimplexCategory/Basic.lean`.

- `Mathlib/AlgebraicTopology/SimplexCategory/Defs.lean` contains the core definitions and notations needed to define the simplex category, the truncated simplex category, and their respective `SmallCategory` instances.
- `Mathlib/AlgebraicTopology/SimplexCategory/Basic.lean` contains everything else.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
This is partly in anticipation of #20688 and #20719, which together would put `SimplexCategory.lean` around 1140 lines. Whether that is big enough to justify this split may be a topic of debate.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13325192974/job/37216841470)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13325192974/job/37216841170)
Is this the correct thing to do when I create a new file of which I am not the author?

I think you should keep the year and `(c)` of the original file. Ideally, the authors line can be updated by taking into account the output of `git blame` (both on mathlib4 and mathlib3, as this file was already there...).

I have restored the original copyright, thank you for weighing in on that.

It sounds like you are suggesting that the authors of `SimplexCategory/Defs.lean` should possibly be different than the authors of the original `SimplexCategory.lean` (updated according to the blame). Is that correct?

A cursory review of the mathlib4 and mathlib3 blames suggests that the authors of the specific content in `SimplexCategory/Defs.lean` match reasonably well with the authors of the original `SimplexCategory.lean`. For instance, `len`, `len_mk`, `mk_len`, and the truncated simplex category were added in [mathlib3#6711](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/6711). Much of the other content in `Defs.lean` goes back to [mathlib3#6761](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/6761).

One possible update is adding the estimable @joelriou, who both ported `SimplexCategory.lean` to mathlib4 in #3286 and authored some of the content specific to `Defs.lean` (e.g. `SimplexCategory.rec` in [mathlib3#16072](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/16072)). I'm unsure, however, what the convention is (or was) around adding authors related to the mathlib4 port.

tl;dr: I would be happy to add @joelriou to the list of authors of `Defs.lean` if that is appropriate, but otherwise I think the authors are reasonably correct as listed.
No, I contributed much more to what is going to be `Basic.lean`, see https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/16276 and https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib3/pull/11924

```suggestion
Authors: Johan Commelin, Kim Morrison, Adam Topaz, Jo√´l Riou
```
